config.description: Configuration data for global QoS

enable-qos.description: Use this attribute to globally enable or disable QoS

red-drop-disabled.description: Use this attribute to disable red packet drop in the system. Red packets are dropped in the system by default to achieve ingress rate limiting via policer and storm control. However, this command is used when there is no use-case for rate limiting traffic and red packets need to be allowed in the system

statistics-enabled.description: Use this attribute to enable QoS statistics

block-size.description: Use this attribute to configure block-size for vlan-queuing

state.description: Operational state data fot global QoS

red-drop-disabled.description: Use this attribute to disable red packet drop in the system. Red packets are dropped in the system by default to achieve ingress rate limiting via policer and storm control. However, this command is used when there is no use-case for rate limiting traffic and red packets need to be allowed in the system

access-control-list-name.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Access Control List (ACL)

cos.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Class of Service (CoS) value

inner-cos.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on inner Class of Service (CoS) value

vlan.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on VLAN ID. Enter VLAN ID 1-4094 or range of VLAN ID's.

inner-vlan.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on inner VLAN ID. Enter VLAN ID 1-4094 or range of VLAN ID's.

rtp.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP). The rtp value 2000-65535 or range of rtp values.

mpls-exp.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the MPLS experimental (EXP) value

dscp.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Differentiated Services Control Protocol (DSCP) value. Warning: In CLI show running, DSCP values with well-known names (ex.: af11, cs0) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, DSCP values will always be numeric.

ipv6-dscp.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Differentiated Services Control Protocol (DSCP) value. Warning: In CLI show running, DSCP values with well-known names (ex.: af11, cs0) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, DSCP values will always be numeric.

precedence.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the precedence value. Warning: In CLI show running, precedence values with well-known names (ex.: priority, immediate) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, precedence values will always be numeric.

ipv6-precedence.description: Use this attribute to classify IPv6 traffic based on the precedence value. Warning: In CLI show running, precedence values with well-known names (ex.: priority, immediate) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, precedence values will always be numeric.

ethertype.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the EtherType value(s)

traffic-type.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the traffic type value

packet-protocol.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the protocol

source-mac.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the source MAC address. The MAC address value allow up to 17 characters.

destination-mac.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the destination MAC address. The MAC address value allow up to 17 characters.

state.description: Operational state data for QoS class match-any

access-control-list-name.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Access Control List (ACL)

cos.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Class of Service (CoS) value

inner-cos.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on inner Class of Service (CoS) value

vlan.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on VLAN ID. Enter VLAN ID 1-4094 or range of VLAN ID's.

inner-vlan.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on inner VLAN ID. Enter VLAN ID 1-4094 or range of VLAN ID's.

mpls-exp.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the MPLS experimental (EXP) value

dscp.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Differentiated Services Control Protocol (DSCP) value. Warning: In CLI show running, DSCP values with well-known names (ex.: af11, cs0) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, DSCP values will always be numeric.

ethertype-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the EtherType value

traffic-type-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the traffic type

cos-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Class of Service (CoS) value

inner-cos-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the inner Class of Service (CoS) value

vlan-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the VLAN ID

inner-vlan-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the inner VLAN ID

rtp-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP)

mpls-exp-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the MPLS experimental (EXP) value

dscp-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Differentiated Services Control Protocol (DSCP) value. The DSCP value range is 0-63. Warning: In CLI show running, DSCP values with well-known names (ex.: af11, cs0) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, DSCP values will always be numeric. The string type allow up to 8 characters on well-known name.

ipv6-dscp-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the Differentiated Services Control Protocol (DSCP) value upon IPv6 packet. The DSCP value range is 0-63. Warning: In CLI show running, DSCP values with well-known names (ex.: af11, cs0) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, DSCP values will always be numeric. The string type allow up to 8 characters on well-known name.

precedence-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the precedence value. The precedence value range is 0-7. Warning: In CLI show running, precedence values with well-known names (ex.: priority, immediate) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, precedence values will always be numeric. The string type allow up to 13 characters on well-known name.

ipv6-precedence-all.description: Use this attribute to classify traffic based on the precedence value upon IPv6 packet. The precedence value range is 0-7. Warning: In CLI show running, precedence values with well-known names (ex.: priority, immediate) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, precedence values will always be numeric. The string type allow up to 13 characters on well-known name.

precedence-remark.description: Use this attribute to match traffic classes set action as change precedence in the egress packet to the defined value. The precedence value range is 0-7. Warning: In CLI show running, precedence values with well-known names (ex.: priority, immediate) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, precedence values will always be numeric. The string type allow up to 13 characters on well-known name.

cos-value.description: Use this attribute to match traffic classes set action as change CoS in the egress packet to the defined value

cos-remark-only-bridged.description: Use this attribute to enable remarking only bridged packets

dscp-value-remark.description: Use this attribute to match traffic classes set action as change DSCP in the egress packet to the defined value. The DSCP value range is 0-63. Warning: In CLI show running, DSCP values with well-known names (ex.: af11, cs0) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, DSCP values will always be numeric. The string type allow up to 8 characters on well-known name.

dscp-remark-only-bridged.description: Use this attribute to enable remarking only bridged packets. The DSCP value range is 0-63. Warning: In CLI show running, DSCP values with well-known names (ex.: af11, cs0) will be displayed as such. On Netconf, DSCP values will always be numeric. The string type allow up to 8 characters on well-known name.

dei.description: Use this command to enable/disable remarking of DEI set by the egress map

dscp.description: Use this command to enable/disable remarking of DSCP set by the egress map

traffic-shape.description: Configuration data for QoS traffic shape

config.description: Configuration data for QoS traffic shape

rate.description: Use this attribute to configure shaping on an egress queue to impose a maximum rate on it

rate-unit.description: Use this attribute to set the shape rate unit

burst-rate.description: Use this attribute to set a shape rate burst
